abstract: Regulating over-the-counter derivatives is vital to preventing another financial crisis, William D. Cohan writes.
snippet: Regulating over-the-counter derivatives is vital to preventing another financial crisis, William D. Cohan writes.
lead_paragraph: From William D. Cohan at Opinionator:

headline.main: A Bomb Squad for Wall Street

abstract: Highlighting the complicated ties that have arisen between the government and Wall Street since the bank bailout, President Obama’s proposal Thursday to reign in some the largest financial institutions sent some of Uncle Sam’s own share holdings down.
snippet: Highlighting the complicated ties that have arisen between the government and Wall Street since the bank bailout, President Obama’s proposal Thursday to reign in some the largest financial institutions sent some of Uncle Sam’s own share holdings d...
lead_paragraph: Highlighting the complicated ties that have arisen between the government and Wall Street since the taxpayer’s bailout of some of the nation’s largest banks, President Obama’s proposal, unveiled Thursday, to reign in some the largest financial institutions sent some of Uncle Sam’s own share holdings down.

headline.main: U.S. Takes a $1.5 Billion Hit as Citi Drops

abstract: Hershey announced Friday that it will not bid for Cadbury, making official what analysts and investors have suspected since Kraft presented a $19 billion revised offer that had the blessing of the Cadbury board.
snippet: Hershey announced Friday that it will not bid for Cadbury, making official what analysts and investors have suspected since Kraft presented a $19 billion revised offer that had the blessing of the Cadbury board.
lead_paragraph: Hershey announced Friday that it would not bid for Cadbury, making official what analysts and investors had suspected since Kraft presented a $19 billion revised offer that had the blessing of the Cadbury board.

headline.main: Hershey Won’t Challenge Kraft for Cadbury

byline.original: By Michael J. de la Merced

abstract: Many Republicans have opposed appointing Ben S. Bernanke to a second term as chairman of the Federal Reserve. Now two stalwart Democrats are taking aim too.
snippet: Many Republicans have opposed appointing Ben S. Bernanke to a second term as chairman of the Federal Reserve. Now two stalwart Democrats are taking aim too.
